channel.title: R on John Doe's blog
channel.description: Recent content in R on John Doe's blog

item.title: Scatter Plots
item.description: library(Lahman) library(sqldf) library(ggplot2) query<-"SELECT playerID,sum(HR) AS career_hr,sum(SO) AS career_so FROM Batting GROUP BY playerID HAVING sum(HR)>=400" result<-sqldf(query) ggplot()+ geom_point(data=result,aes(x=career_so,y=career_hr),size=3,color="blue")+ ggtitle("Career Strikeouts VS Homeruns for Great Hitters")+ xlab("career strikeouts")+ ylab("career homeruns")

item.title: Welcome to Data Science
item.description: Welcome to Breonna’s blog! This blog will be information and examples that are provided in Dr. Redmond’s Intro to Data Science class at Mercyhurst University. The examples for the earlier work with SQL are done on my other website…. https://bbaile99.github.io/website/

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
